intro: Pteropsis piloselloides, commonly known as the hairy groundsel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
